com.here.android.mpa.mapping

Class MapRoute

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.android.mpa.common.ViewObject
      • com.here.android.mpa.mapping.MapObject
        • com.here.android.mpa.mapping.MapRoute

  • public final class MapRoute
extends MapObject
    Represents a Route that can be displayed on a Map.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MapRoute

        public MapRoute()
        Creates a MapRoute object.

      • MapRoute

        public MapRoute(Route route)
        Creates a MapRoute with a specified Route.

        Typically, a MapRoute is created after a Route has been calculated. An application can pass a calculated Route as a parameter to this method instead of making an explicit call to MapRoute.setRoute(Route). Adding the new MapRoute object to a Map can be done by way of the Map.addMapObject(MapObject) method.

        Parameters:
        route - A calculated Route used to set to the MapRoute

    • Method Detail

      • isManeuverNumberVisible

        public boolean isManeuverNumberVisible()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether maneuver numbers are displayed along with this route.
        Returns:
        True if maneuver numbers are displayed with the route, false otherwise

      • setManeuverNumberVisible

        public MapRoute setManeuverNumberVisible(boolean visible)
        Sets maneuver numbers to be either displayed along with this route or not displayed. By default, maneuver number is invisible.
        Parameters:
        visible - A boolean specifying whether maneuver numbers are displayed
        Returns:
        The updated MapRoute itself.

      • getColor

        public int getColor()
        Returns the current ARGB (Alpha/Red/Green/Blue) integer color value used to display this route.
        Returns:
        The current ARGB integer color value. The packed integer is made up of 4 bytes: alpha, red, green, blue. Each color component has a value range from [0..255], with 0 meaning no contribution for that component and 255 meaning 100% contribution
        See Also:
        android.graphics.Color

      • setColor

        public MapRoute setColor(int argbColor)
        Sets a color for displaying the route, using an ARGB (Alpha/Red/Green/Blue) integer color value.

        Note: calling setRenderType(RenderType) will reset any color previously set by using this method.

        Parameters:
        argbColor - The ARGB integer color value. The packed integer is made up of 4 bytes: alpha, red, green, blue. Each color component has a value range from [0..255], with 0 meaning no contribution for that component and 255 meaning 100% contribution.
        Returns:
        The updated MapRoute itself.
        See Also:
        android.graphics.Color

      • getRoute

        public Route getRoute()
        Returns the Route that has been displayed on the Map.
        Returns:
        The Route

      • setRoute

        public MapRoute setRoute(Route route)
        Sets a Route that will be displayed on the Map.
        Parameters:
        route - A Route representing the route to be displayed on the Map.
        Returns:
        The updated MapRoute itself.

      • setRenderType

        public MapRoute setRenderType(MapRoute.RenderType type)
        Sets the RenderType associated with this . Note that MapRoute must be added to a Map before calling this method.

        Note: route color can be customized by MapRoute.setColor(int)

        Parameters:
        type - RenderType
        Returns:
        The updated MapRoute itself.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if type is invalid.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if MapRoute is not added to Map.

      • getRenderType

        public MapRoute.RenderType getRenderType()
        Get the RenderType associated with this .
        Returns:
        RenderType

      • setTrafficEnabled

        public MapRoute setTrafficEnabled(boolean enable)
        Enable display of traffic on this MapRoute. By default traffic on route is disabled.

        NOTE: Truck routes and public transport timetable routes are unsupported.

        Parameters:
        enable - True will display traffic if MapTrafficLayer.RenderLayer.ONROUTE and Map.setTrafficInfoVisible(boolean) have been enabled. False will hide traffic on route rendering for this route.
        Returns:
        The updated MapRoute itself.

      • isTrafficEnabled

        public boolean isTrafficEnabled()
        Checks if traffic is enabled for this route.
        Returns:
        True if traffic is enabled for this MapRoute, false otherwise.

      • setVisibleMask

        public MapObject setVisibleMask(int level)
        This API is not supported by MapRoute as MapRoute's visibility for specific zoom level cannot be specified. To enable MapRoute's visibility on all zoom level, use MapObject.setVisible(boolean) instead.
        Overrides:
        setVisibleMask in class MapObject
        Parameters:
        level - A zoom level
        Returns:
        The updated MapObject itself.
        See Also:
        MapObject.setVisible(boolean), MapObject.setVisibleMask(int, int), MapObject.unsetVisibleMask(int), MapObject.unsetVisibleMask(int, int), MapObject.getVisibleMask()

      • unsetVisibleMask

        public MapObject unsetVisibleMask(int level)
        This API is not supported by MapRoute as MapRoute's visibility for specific zoom level cannot be specified. To change MapRoute's visibility on all zoom level, use MapObject.setVisible(boolean) instead.
        Overrides:
        unsetVisibleMask in class MapObject
        Parameters:
        level - A zoom level
        Returns:
        The updated MapObject itself.
        See Also:
        MapObject.setVisible(boolean), MapObject.unsetVisibleMask(int, int), MapObject.setVisibleMask(int), MapObject.setVisibleMask(int, int), MapObject.getVisibleMask()

      • setVisibleMask

        public MapObject setVisibleMask(int levelStart,
                       int levelEnd)
        This API is not supported by MapRoute as MapRoute's visibility for specific zoom level cannot be specified. To change MapRoute's visibility on all zoom level, use MapObject.setVisible(boolean) instead.
        Overrides:
        setVisibleMask in class MapObject
        Parameters:
        levelStart - A starting zoom level of the range
        levelEnd - An ending zoom level of the range
        Returns:
        The updated MapObject itself.
        See Also:
        MapObject.setVisible(boolean), MapObject.setVisibleMask(int), MapObject.unsetVisibleMask(int), MapObject.unsetVisibleMask(int, int), MapObject.getVisibleMask()

      • resetVisibleMask

        public MapObject resetVisibleMask(boolean set)
        This API is not supported by MapRoute as MapRoute's visibility for specific zoom level cannot be specified. To change MapRoute's visibility on all zoom level, use MapObject.setVisible(boolean) instead.
        Overrides:
        resetVisibleMask in class MapObject
        Parameters:
        set - True to reset mask to all 1s; false to reset mask to all 0s
        Returns:
        The updated MapObject itself.
        See Also:
        MapObject.setVisible(boolean)

      • unsetVisibleMask

        public MapObject unsetVisibleMask(int levelStart,
                         int levelEnd)
        This API is not supported by MapRoute as MapRoute's visibility for specific zoom level cannot be specified. To change MapRoute's visibility on all zoom level, use MapObject.setVisible(boolean) instead.
        Overrides:
        unsetVisibleMask in class MapObject
        Parameters:
        levelStart - A starting zoom level of the range
        levelEnd - An ending zoom level of the range
        Returns:
        The updated MapObject itself.
        See Also:
        MapObject.setVisible(boolean), MapObject.unsetVisibleMask(int), MapObject.setVisibleMask(int), MapObject.setVisibleMask(int, int), MapObject.getVisibleMask()

      • getVisibleMask

        public java.util.BitSet getVisibleMask()
        This API is not supported by MapRoute as MapRoute's visibility for specific zoom level cannot be specified. To query MapRoute's visibility setting on all zoom level, use MapObject.isVisible() instead.
        Overrides:
        getVisibleMask in class MapObject
        Returns:
        BitSet which defines the visibility bit mask of the MapObject
